intro: Balinotella libanotis subsp. leiocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-seeded Lebanon bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its smooth, hairless seeds and compact growth habit. It typically thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to temperate climates. This plant is often found in open woodlands and alpine meadows, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
